title: " "

# Testes de Hipóteses

Os testes de hipótese são ferramentas estatísticas fundamentais usadas para tomar decisões baseadas em dados amostrais. Eles são projetados para avaliar a validade de afirmações sobre uma população com base em evidências coletadas em uma amostra. Aqui você aprenderá a realizar estes testes no RStudio.

Importando os dados


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_70905bec6c6b3c2de82ff4d2656075f3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
mg <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=983033137")
```
:::


Vizualização gráfica


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_084bbe6bdbfdfaa186788249e4d9da97'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)

mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Teste t para dois grupos de médias independentes

Modificando os dados


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_aae66ce76fa69bc5c535948bf86425ab'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Passar os dados para o formato largo.
mg2 <- mg |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = trat, values_from = comp)
 
mg2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
     rep   Mg2 control
   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
 1     1   9      13.7
 2     2  12.5    15.9
 3     3  10      15.7
 4     4   8      14.2
 5     5  13.2    15.9
 6     6  11      16.5
 7     7  10.8    18  
 8     8   9.5    14.4
 9     9  10.8    16.4
10    10  10.4    16  
```
:::
:::


### Testando as premissas do teste t

As premissas para a aplicação do teste t são fundamentais para garantir a validade dos resultados

As premissas são: normalidade e homogeneidade de variância.

Normalidade


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_ca75667314cab361fba7f37a7318e4c2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Primeira resposta
shapiro.test(mg2$control) # No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal.
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$control
W = 0.93886, p-value = 0.5404
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_46ce5d522e86e29d5d87176a90f20373'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Segunda resposta
shapiro.test(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$Mg2
W = 0.97269, p-value = 0.9146
```
:::
:::


Gráficos de histograma podem nos ajudar a concluir sobre a normalidade de distribuição dos dados, veja:


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_16e00532a8770c54a705f915fbcc66da'}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_6f834584fb662caf0cb225cd3476ddde'}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Executando `qqnorm()` e `qqline()` também temos resposta sobre a normalidade dos dados


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_f87b65113ba384bee121ff29fd6c9699'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(mg2$control)
qqline(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_d7b2fdc6621bf0c76eccf382a439c5a6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(mg2$Mg2)
qqline(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Homogeneidade de variância


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_2ff8d6ee5993870a67ded55dba919d7f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
var.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2) # HO é que a variância é homogênea.
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  mg2$control and mg2$Mg2
F = 0.67654, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.5698
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.1680428 2.7237436
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
         0.6765394 
```
:::
:::


Realizando o teste


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_8838033598a7b29bc91b0481d97d0d62'}

```{.r .cell-code}
teste1 <- t.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2) #Pode usar 'var.equal = FALSE' quando a variância for heterogênea
```
:::


### Reportando o resultado

O pacote **report** transcreve o resultado do seu teste estatístico e pode ser utilizado da seguinte forma:


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_260be9d4967ea857ae6a0b3072fd410c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(report)
report(teste1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Welch Two Sample t-test testing the difference between mg2$control and
mg2$Mg2 (mean of x = 15.68, mean of y = 10.52) suggests that the effect is
positive, statistically significant, and large (difference = 5.16, 95% CI
[3.83, 6.49], t(17.35) = 8.15, p < .001; Cohen's d = 3.65, 95% CI [2.14, 5.12])
```
:::
:::


## Teste t para dois grupos de médias dependentes

Também conhecido como teste pareado, é aplicado quando as observações em uma amostra são dependentes, como antes e depois de um tratamento aplicado em um mesmo grupo de indivíduos.

Importando e montando um gráfico com os dados:


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_0c43f3405ef733d6856ae6506a88645d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
escala <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1729131173")

#Vizualizar
escala |> 
  ggplot(aes(assessment, acuracia))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Modificações

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_ad175e56c864e0573e80314ea7795571'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Formato largo
escala2 <- escala |> 
  dplyr::select(assessment, rater, acuracia)|>
  pivot_wider(names_from = assessment, values_from = acuracia)

 escala2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   rater Unaided Aided1
   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
 1 A        0.81   0.91
 2 B        0.72   0.91
 3 C        0.4    0.91
 4 D        0.82   0.96
 5 E        0.75   0.96
 6 F        0.45   0.9 
 7 G        0.81   0.85
 8 H        0.78   0.88
 9 I        0.78   0.95
10 J        0.5    0.94
```
:::
:::


Testando as premissas

Normalidade


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_e8af9a635ce5454f3779c648ceb7d3c9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala2$Unaided
W = 0.7748, p-value = 0.007155
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_7ca052a5949fc401b2cfd3d35c14bf3a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_a813d892e2fc15401f7d97320718dffe'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala2$Unaided)
qqline(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_202c479dd350296ec242713243048cde'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala2$Aided1
W = 0.92852, p-value = 0.4335
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_ef6a5f588d8e323a2b8994e018e1c539'}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_21885096a6640aa7ef91a0ccdb0b521d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala2$Aided1)
qqline(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Homogeneidade de variância


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_894976bcab8ec30995d4ce00e05f17e3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
var.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  escala2$Unaided and escala2$Aided1
F = 20.978, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.000106
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
  5.210754 84.459185
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
          20.97847 
```
:::
:::


Realizando o teste e reportando


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-22_ea6fbe1c4a3df60171edb71d2304e8e5'}

```{.r .cell-code}
teste2 <- t.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1,
                 paired = TRUE,
                 var.equal = FALSE) #Usar 'paired = TRUE' quando o teste t for pareado (média dependentes) e 'var.equal = FALSE' quando a variância for heterogêneanea


report(teste2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Paired t-test testing the difference between escala2$Unaided and
escala2$Aided1 (mean difference = -0.23) suggests that the effect is negative,
statistically significant, and large (difference = -0.23, 95% CI [-0.36,
-0.11], t(9) = -4.42, p = 0.002; Cohen's d = -1.40, 95% CI [-2.27, -0.49])
```
:::
:::


## Teste de Wilcoxon

O teste de Wilcoxon, também conhecido como teste de Wilcoxon de postos sinalizados, é um teste não paramétrico utilizado para comparar duas amostras relacionadas. Ele é particularmente útil quando as premissas do teste t pareado, como a normalidade das diferenças, não são atendidas.

Com o mesmo conjunto de dados, supondo que as premissas não sejam atendidas (p \< 0.05), o teste pode ser realizado da seguinte forma:


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-23_46387e3a1b37c61fdba662330b89978b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
teste3 <- wilcox.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1, paired = TRUE)

teste3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction

data:  escala2$Unaided and escala2$Aided1
V = 0, p-value = 0.005889
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-24_fe239c9c74a6dc0bb736047e7de5c238'}

```{.r .cell-code}
micelial <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=959387827")

#Vizualizar
micelial |> 
  ggplot(aes(especie, tcm))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1, size = 2)+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova_micelial <- aov(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)
 
anova_micelial
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call:
   aov(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Terms:
                  especie Residuals
Sum of Squares  1.4695800 0.4679167
Deg. of Freedom         4        25

Residual standard error: 0.1368089
Estimated effects may be unbalanced
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(anova_micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
especie      4 1.4696  0.3674   19.63 2.03e-07 ***
Residuals   25 0.4679  0.0187                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(anova_micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: tcm
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
especie    4 1.46958 0.36739  19.629 2.028e-07 ***
Residuals 25 0.46792 0.01872                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova_micelial2 <- lm(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

anova_micelial2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)  especieFaus  especieFcor  especieFgra  especieFmer  
      1.572       -0.335       -0.250       -0.660       -0.145  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(anova_micelial2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:

Residuals:

-0.23667 -0.09667  0.01583  0.08833  0.28333
```

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(anova_micelial2)
```
